Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Incomplete cylindrical vase with straight and thin rim and walls. The surface has been smoothed down and is covered with an orangey-coloured coating, both on the inside and on the outside. It shows a painted decoration of five lotus flowers with long stems formed by oblique lines in a herringbone design, vertically arranged, alternating with buds, also in a vertical position. The whole composition is framed by two longitudinal lines.
